title.raw: 卷一上 高帝紀上 Volume 1: Annals of Emperor Gaozu 1

sentences.zh: 高祖，沛豐邑中陽里人也，姓劉氏。

translations.literal: Gaozu was a person from Zhongyang Village, Fengyi Township, Pei County, and his surname was Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu hailed from Zhongyang Village in Fengyi Township, Pei County, and bore the surname Liu.

sentences.zh: 母媼嘗息大澤之陂，夢與神遇。

translations.literal: His mother once rested by the bank of Daze Marsh, and dreamed that she encountered a god.
translations.idiomatic: His mother once rested by the shore of Daze Marsh and dreamt of meeting a divine being.

sentences.zh: 是時雷電晦冥，父太公往視，則見交龍於上。

translations.literal: At that time there was thunder and lightning, darkness and obscurity; his father Taigong went to look, and then saw two dragons mating above.
translations.idiomatic: Thunder crashed and lightning flashed in the darkened heavens; his father Taigong went to investigate and witnessed two dragons entwined above.

sentences.zh: 已而有娠，遂產高祖。

translations.literal: Soon after she became pregnant, and then gave birth to Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: She soon conceived and thereafter bore Emperor Gaozu.

translations.literal: Emperor Gaozu hailed from Zhongyang Village in Fengyi Township, Pei County, and bore the surname Liu. His mother once rested by the shore of Daze Marsh and dreamt of meeting a divine being. Thunder crashed and lightning flashed in the darkened heavens; his father Taigong went to investigate and witnessed two dragons entwined above. She soon conceived and thereafter bore Emperor Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖為人，隆準而龍顏，美須髯，左股有七十二黑子。

translations.literal: 高祖為人，隆準而龍顏，美須髯，左股有七十二黑子。
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu had a prominent nose and dragon-like features, beautiful whiskers and beard, and seventy-two black moles on his left thigh.

sentences.zh: 寬仁愛人，意豁如也。

translations.literal: 仁而愛人，喜施，意豁如也。
translations.idiomatic: He was benevolent and loved people, enjoyed giving charity, and had an open-hearted disposition.

sentences.zh: 常有大度，不事家人生產作 業。

translations.literal: 常有大度，不事家人生產作業。
translations.idiomatic: He always had great generosity of spirit and did not engage in the family's farming and labor.

sentences.zh: 及壯，試吏，為泗上亭長，廷中吏無所不狎侮。

translations.literal: 及壯，學書不成，去；學劍，又不成。
translations.idiomatic: When he grew to adulthood, he studied writing but did not succeed, so he left; he studied swordsmanship, but again did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 好酒及色。

translations.literal: 嘆曰：「書劍終窮哉？」
translations.idiomatic: He sighed and said, 'Will the paths of scholarship and swordsmanship ultimately lead nowhere?'

sentences.zh: 常從王媼、武負貰酒，時飲醉臥，武負、王媼見其上常有怪。

translations.literal: 及見秦皇帝，車騎眾，覺其異，乃歎曰：「嗟乎，大丈夫當如此也！」
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the Qin emperor with his many chariots and cavalry, he realized how extraordinary it was, and sighed, 'Alas, this is how a great man should be!'

sentences.zh: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。

translations.literal: 單父人呂公善沛令，避仇，從之客，因家焉。
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong from Shanfu was friendly with the magistrate of Pei; to avoid his enemies, he became a guest there and settled his family.

sentences.zh: 及見怪，歲 竟，此兩家常折券棄責。

translations.literal: 呂公女乃呂后也，生孝惠、魯元公主。
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong's daughter was Empress Lü, who gave birth to Emperor Hui and Princess Lu Yuan.

translations.literal: Emperor Gaozu had a prominent nose and dragon-like features, beautiful whiskers and beard, and seventy-two black moles on his left thigh. He was benevolent and loved people, enjoyed giving charity, and had an open-hearted disposition. He always had great generosity of spirit and did not engage in the family's farming and labor. When he grew to adulthood, he studied writing but did not succeed, so he left; he studied swordsmanship, but again did not succeed. He sighed and said, 'Will the paths of scholarship and swordsmanship ultimately lead nowhere?' When he saw the Qin emperor with his many chariots and cavalry, he realized how extraordinary it was, and sighed, 'Alas, this is how a great man should be!' Lü Gong from Shanfu was friendly with the magistrate of Pei; to avoid his enemies, he became a guest there and settled his family. Lü Gong's daughter was Empress Lü, who gave birth to Emperor Hui and Princess Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 高祖常繇咸陽，縱觀秦皇帝，喟然大息，曰：「嗟乎，大丈夫當如此矣！」

translations.literal: 及長，家貧，呂公女配高祖，生惠帝、魯元。
translations.idiomatic: When she grew up, the family was poor; Lü Gong's daughter was married to Gaozu and bore Emperor Hui and Lu Yuan.

translations.literal: When she grew up, the family was poor; Lü Gong's daughter was married to Gaozu and bore Emperor Hui and Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 單父人呂公善沛令，辟仇，從之客，因家焉。

translations.literal: 沛中子弟或聞其異，皆嘲笑之。
translations.idiomatic: Some of the young men of Pei heard of his unusual nature and all mocked and laughed at him.

sentences.zh: 沛中豪傑吏聞令有重客，皆往賀。

translations.literal: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。
translations.idiomatic: Whenever Gaozu bought wine to drink, the tavern keeper charged him several times the amount.

sentences.zh: 蕭何為主吏，主進，令諸 大夫曰：「進不滿千錢，坐之堂下。」

translations.literal: 及見怪，歲竟，此兩家常折券棄責。
translations.idiomatic: When they saw that he was unusual, at the end of each year these two families would tear up the debt contracts and forgive his obligations.

sentences.zh: 高祖為亭長，素易諸吏，乃紿為謁曰「賀錢萬」，實不持一錢。

translations.literal: 高祖怪之，問曰：「何故而然？」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was puzzled by this and asked, 'Why do you do this?'

sentences.zh: 謁入，呂公大驚，起，迎之門。

translations.literal: 兩家曰：「君何言之闇也！長者千金，子孫息，君衣帛，買爵，君何言之闇也！」
translations.idiomatic: The two families said, 'How can you speak so ignorantly! When the elders give a thousand pieces of gold, their descendants multiply; you wear silk clothes and buy official ranks—how can you speak so ignorantly!'

sentences.zh: 呂公者，好相人，見高祖狀 貌，因重敬之，引入坐上坐。

translations.literal: 高祖豁達大度，聞之，輒喜，自知者少。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was broad-minded and magnanimous; hearing this, he was immediately pleased, realizing that few understood him.

sentences.zh: 蕭何曰：「劉季固多大言，少成事。」

translations.literal: 高祖常繇咸陽，縶亭長，灞上亭。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu often traveled the corvée road to Xianyang, stopping at the pavilion chief's station at Ba Terrace.

sentences.zh: 高祖因狎侮諸客，遂坐上坐，無所詘。

translations.literal: 亭長妻有從者，醉酒，夜徑澤中，行徑澤中。
translations.idiomatic: The pavilion chief had a wife with attendants; getting drunk on wine, they traveled at night through the marshes, going through the marshes.

sentences.zh: 酒闌，呂公因目固留高祖。

translations.literal: 令一人先行，前者還報曰：「前有大蛇當徑，願還。」
translations.idiomatic: He ordered one person to go ahead; the one who went ahead returned and reported: 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.'

sentences.zh: 竟酒，後。

translations.literal: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'

sentences.zh: 呂公曰：「臣少好 相人，相人多矣，無如季相，願季自愛。

translations.literal: 乃前，拔劍擊斬蛇，徑分為兩。
translations.idiomatic: He went forward, drew his sword, and struck down the snake, splitting it into two parts along the path.

sentences.zh: 臣有息女，願為箕帚妾。」

translations.literal: 徑行至鰐蛇所，醉臥。
translations.idiomatic: He walked along the path to where the snake had been and lay down drunk.

sentences.zh: 酒罷，呂媼怒呂公曰：「公始常欲奇此女，與貴人。

translations.literal: 後人來至蛇所，有一老嫗夜哭。
translations.idiomatic: Later, people came to where the snake was, and there was an old woman crying at night.

sentences.zh: 沛令善公，求之不與，何自妄許與劉季？」

translations.literal: 人問何哭，嫗曰：「人殺吾子，故哭之。」
translations.idiomatic: People asked why she was crying; the old woman said, 'Someone killed my son, so I cry for him.'

sentences.zh: 呂公曰：「此非兒女子所知。」

translations.literal: 人曰：「嫗子何為見殺？」
translations.idiomatic: The people said, 'Old woman's son, why was he killed?'

sentences.zh: 卒與高祖。

translations.literal: 嫗曰：「吾子，白帝子也，化為蛇，當徑，今為赤帝子斬之，故哭。」
translations.idiomatic: The old woman said, 'My son is the son of the White Emperor; he transformed into a snake to block the path, but now he has been slain by the son of the Red Emperor, so I cry.'

sentences.zh: 呂公女即呂后也，生孝惠帝、魯元公主。

translations.literal: 人以嫗為不誠，欲笞之；嫗因忽不見。
translations.idiomatic: The people considered the old woman dishonest and wanted to beat her; but the old woman suddenly disappeared.

translations.literal: Some of the young men of Pei heard of his unusual nature and all mocked and laughed at him. Whenever Gaozu bought wine to drink, the tavern keeper charged him several times the amount. When they saw that he was unusual, at the end of each year these two families would tear up the debt contracts and forgive his obligations. Gaozu was puzzled by this and asked, 'Why do you do this?' The two families said, 'How can you speak so ignorantly! When the elders give a thousand pieces of gold, their descendants multiply; you wear silk clothes and buy official ranks—how can you speak so ignorantly!' Gaozu was broad-minded and magnanimous; hearing this, he was immediately pleased, realizing that few understood him. Gaozu often traveled the corvée road to Xianyang, stopping at the pavilion chief's station at Ba Terrace. The pavilion chief had a wife with attendants; getting drunk on wine, they traveled at night through the marshes, going through the marshes. He ordered one person to go ahead; the one who went ahead returned and reported: 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.' Gaozu was drunk and said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!' He went forward, drew his sword, and struck down the snake, splitting it into two parts along the path. He walked along the path to where the snake had been and lay down drunk. Later, people came to where the snake was, and there was an old woman crying at night. People asked why she was crying; the old woman said, 'Someone killed my son, so I cry for him.' The people said, 'Old woman's son, why was he killed?' The old woman said, 'My son is the son of the White Emperor; he transformed into a snake to block the path, but now he has been slain by the son of the Red Emperor, so I cry.' The people considered the old woman dishonest and wanted to beat her; but the old woman suddenly disappeared.

sentences.zh: 高祖嘗告歸之田。

translations.literal: 後人至，高祖覺，告之。
translations.idiomatic: Later, when people arrived, Gaozu awoke and told them about it.

sentences.zh: 呂后與兩子居田中，有一老父過請飲，呂后因餔之。

translations.literal: 高祖乃心獨喜，自負。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was secretly pleased in his heart and felt self-confident.

sentences.zh: 老父相后曰：「夫人天下貴人 也。」

translations.literal: 諸從者日益畏之。
translations.idiomatic: His followers grew increasingly in awe of him.

sentences.zh: 令相兩子，見孝惠帝，曰：「夫人所以貴者，乃此男也。」

translations.literal: 秦始皇帝常曰：「東南有天子氣。」
translations.idiomatic: Qin Shihuang often said, 'There is imperial aura in the southeast.'

sentences.zh: 相魯元公主，亦皆貴。

translations.literal: 於是東游以厭當之。
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he traveled east to suppress it.

sentences.zh: 老父已去，高祖適從旁舍來，呂后具言客有過，相我子母皆大貴。

translations.literal: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒騉山，徒多道亡。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu, as pavilion chief, escorted convicts from the county to Mount Li; many convicts escaped along the way.

sentences.zh: 高祖問， 曰：「未遠。」

translations.literal: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中，止飲，夜乃解縱所送徒。
translations.idiomatic: He estimated that by the time they arrived, all would have escaped; when they reached the western marshes of Feng, he stopped for a drink, and at night released all the convicts he was escorting.

sentences.zh: 乃追及，問老父。

translations.literal: 曰：「公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'You all go; I too will depart from here!'

sentences.zh: 老父曰：「鄉者夫人兒子皆以君，君相貴不可言。」

translations.literal: 徒中壯士願從者十餘人。
translations.idiomatic: Among the convicts, about ten strong men wished to follow him.

sentences.zh: 高祖乃謝曰：「誠如父言，不敢忘德。」

translations.literal: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and traveled through the marshes at night, ordering one person to go ahead.

sentences.zh: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。

translations.literal: 行前者還報曰：「前有大蛇當徑，願還。」
translations.idiomatic: The one who went ahead returned and reported: 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.'

translations.literal: Later, when people arrived, Gaozu awoke and told them about it. Gaozu was secretly pleased in his heart and felt self-confident. His followers grew increasingly in awe of him. Qin Shihuang often said, 'There is imperial aura in the southeast.' Therefore he traveled east to suppress it. Gaozu, as pavilion chief, escorted convicts from the county to Mount Li; many convicts escaped along the way. He estimated that by the time they arrived, all would have escaped; when they reached the western marshes of Feng, he stopped for a drink, and at night released all the convicts he was escorting. He said, 'You all go; I too will depart from here!' Among the convicts, about ten strong men wished to follow him. Gaozu was drunk and traveled through the marshes at night, ordering one person to go ahead. The one who went ahead returned and reported: 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.'

sentences.zh: 高祖為亭長，乃鲈竹皮為冠，令求盜之薛治，時時冠之，及貴常冠，所謂「劉氏冠」也。

translations.literal: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'

translations.literal: Gaozu was drunk and said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'

sentences.zh: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒驪山，徒多道亡。

translations.literal: 乃前，拔劍擊斬蛇。
translations.idiomatic: He went forward, drew his sword, and struck down the snake.

sentences.zh: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中亭，止飲，夜皆解縱所送徒。

translations.literal: 高祖遂前，抵鹹陽。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu then proceeded forward and arrived at Xianyang.

translations.literal: 諸客遂追隨，高祖以辭去。
translations.idiomatic: The various guests then followed him; Gaozu left with excuses.

translations.literal: He went forward, drew his sword, and struck down the snake. Gaozu then proceeded forward and arrived at Xianyang. The various guests then followed him; Gaozu left with excuses.

sentences.zh: 公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」

translations.literal: 沛公奉項梁客軍，遮擊秦軍於東阿。
translations.idiomatic: Prince Pei served under Xiang Liang's guest army and ambushed Qin forces at Dong'a.

sentences.zh: 徒中壯士願從諸十餘人。

translations.literal: 戰不利，項梁再破秦軍於東阿。
translations.idiomatic: The battle went unfavorably; Xiang Liang again defeated the Qin army at Dong'a.

sentences.zh: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。

translations.literal: 沛公引兵西，遇彭越昌邑。
translations.idiomatic: Prince Pei led his troops west and encountered Peng Yue at Changyi.

sentences.zh: 行前者還報曰：「

translations.literal: 項籍已殺宋義，引兵而西。
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji had already killed Song Yi and led his troops west.

translations.literal: Prince Pei served under Xiang Liang's guest army and ambushed Qin forces at Dong'a. The battle went unfavorably; Xiang Liang again defeated the Qin army at Dong'a. Prince Pei led his troops west and encountered Peng Yue at Changyi. Xiang Ji had already killed Song Yi and led his troops west.

sentences.zh: 前有大蛇當徑，願還。」

translations.literal: 漢王之國，項王使卒三萬人從。
translations.idiomatic: When the Han King went to his fief, Xiang Wang sent thirty thousand soldiers to follow him.

sentences.zh: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」

translations.literal: Gaozu was drunk and said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu, intoxicated, declared, 'A true warrior presses onward—what have we to dread!'

sentences.zh: 乃前，拔劍斬蛇。

translations.literal: He went forward and drew his sword to cut the snake.
translations.idiomatic: He advanced, drew his sword, and slew the serpent.

sentences.zh: 蛇分為兩，道開。

translations.literal: The snake was divided into two, and the path was opened.
translations.idiomatic: The serpent split in twain, clearing the way forward.

sentences.zh: 行數里， 醉困臥。

translations.literal: He walked several li and lay down drunk and tired.
translations.idiomatic: After traveling several li, overcome by wine and exhaustion, he collapsed in slumber.

sentences.zh: 後人來至蛇所，有一老嫗夜哭。

translations.literal: 後人來至蛇所，一老嫗哭曰：「人殺吾子，故哭之。」
translations.idiomatic: Later travelers arrived at the serpent's location; an old woman wept, saying, 'Someone has slain my son, hence I weep.'

sentences.zh: 人問嫗何哭，嫗曰：「人殺吾子。」

translations.literal: 人問曰：「何以殺之？」
translations.idiomatic: The people asked, 'How did he kill it?'

sentences.zh: 人曰：「嫗子何為見殺？」

translations.literal: 嫗曰：「吾子，白帝子也，變為蛇，當道；今赤帝子殺之，故哭。」
translations.idiomatic: The old woman said, 'My son is the son of the White Emperor; he transformed into a snake to block the path. Now the son of the Red Emperor has slain him, so I weep.'

sentences.zh: 嫗曰：「吾子，白帝子也，化為蛇，當道，今者赤帝子斬 之，故哭。」

translations.literal: 人以為不誠，欲笞之；嫗因不見。
translations.idiomatic: The people considered her dishonest and wanted to beat her; the old woman then vanished.

sentences.zh: 人乃以嫗為不誠，欲苦之，嫗因忽不見。

translations.literal: 後聞高祖覺，告以故。
translations.idiomatic: Later, when Gaozu awoke, they told him what had happened.

sentences.zh: 後人至，高祖覺。

translations.literal: 高祖心獨喜，自負。
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was secretly pleased in his heart and felt proud of himself.

sentences.zh: 告高祖，高祖乃心獨喜，自負。

translations.literal: 諸從者日益畏之。
translations.idiomatic: His followers grew increasingly in awe of him.

sentences.zh: 諸從者日益畏之。

translations.literal: 秦始皇帝常曰：「東南有天子氣。」
translations.idiomatic: Qin Shihuang often said, 'There is imperial aura in the southeast.'

translations.literal: When the Han King went to his fief, Xiang Wang sent thirty thousand soldiers to follow him. Gaozu, intoxicated, declared, 'A true warrior presses onward—what have we to dread!' He advanced, drew his sword, and slew the serpent. The serpent split in twain, clearing the way forward. After traveling several li, overcome by wine and exhaustion, he collapsed in slumber. Later travelers arrived at the serpent's location; an old woman wept, saying, 'Someone has slain my son, hence I weep.' The people asked, 'How did he kill it?' The old woman said, 'My son is the son of the White Emperor; he transformed into a snake to block the path. Now the son of the Red Emperor has slain him, so I weep.' The people considered her dishonest and wanted to beat her; the old woman then vanished. Later, when Gaozu awoke, they told him what had happened. Gaozu was secretly pleased in his heart and felt proud of himself. His followers grew increasingly in awe of him. Qin Shihuang often said, 'There is imperial aura in the southeast.'

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝嘗曰「東南有天子氣」，於是東游以猒當之。

translations.literal: 於是東游以厭之。
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he traveled east to suppress it.

sentences.zh: 高祖隱於芒、碭山澤間，呂后與人俱求，常得之。

translations.literal: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒驪山，徒多亡。
translations.idiomatic: As pavilion chief, Gaozu escorted convicts from the county to Mount Li; many convicts escaped.

sentences.zh: 高祖怪問之。

translations.literal: 自度至皆亡，到豐西澤，縱所送徒，曰：「公等皆去，吾亦從此逝。」
translations.idiomatic: He estimated that by the time they arrived all would have fled; upon reaching the western marshes of Feng, he released the convicts he was escorting, saying, 'You all go; I too shall depart from here.'

sentences.zh: 呂后曰：「季所居上常有雲氣，故從往常得季。」

translations.literal: 徒中壯士從者十餘人。
translations.idiomatic: Among the convicts, about ten strong men followed him.

sentences.zh: 高祖又喜。

translations.literal: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤，行前者還曰：「前有大蛇當道，願還。」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and traveled through the marshes at night; the one who went ahead returned, saying, 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.'

sentences.zh: 沛中子弟或聞之，多欲附者矣。

translations.literal: 高祖曰：「壯士行，何畏！」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'

translations.literal: Therefore he traveled east to suppress it. As pavilion chief, Gaozu escorted convicts from the county to Mount Li; many convicts escaped. He estimated that by the time they arrived all would have fled; upon reaching the western marshes of Feng, he released the convicts he was escorting, saying, 'You all go; I too shall depart from here.' Among the convicts, about ten strong men followed him. Gaozu was drunk and traveled through the marshes at night; the one who went ahead returned, saying, 'There is a large snake blocking the path ahead; I wish to turn back.' Gaozu said, 'A brave man walks forward—what is there to fear!'

sentences.zh: 於是樊噲從高祖來。

translations.literal: 乃前，拔劍斬蛇。
translations.idiomatic: He went forward, drew his sword, and cut the snake.

sentences.zh: 沛令後悔，恐其有變，乃閉城城守，欲誅蕭、曹。

translations.literal: 遂至咸陽，諸客皆喜。
translations.idiomatic: He then arrived at Xianyang; all the guests were pleased.

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹恐，踰城保高祖。

translations.literal: 沛令後悔，聞高祖去，欲捕之。
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei later regretted it; hearing that Gaozu had left, he wanted to arrest him.

sentences.zh: 高祖乃書 帛射城上，與沛父老曰：「天下同苦秦久矣。

translations.literal: 高祖恐，告沛令曰：「君賴我無fare，願勿捕。」
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was afraid and told the magistrate of Pei, 'You relied on me to avoid harm; I hope you won't arrest me.'

sentences.zh: 今父老雖為沛令守，諸侯並起，今屠沛。

translations.literal: 沛令乃止，不捕。
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei then stopped and did not arrest him.

sentences.zh: 沛今共誅令，擇可立立之，以應諸侯，即室家完。

translations.literal: 沛公以呂后故，得不誅。
translations.idiomatic: Because of Empress Lü, Prince Pei escaped execution.

sentences.zh: 不然，父子俱屠，無為 也。」

translations.literal: 項籍已殺宋義，引兵而西。
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji had already killed Song Yi and led his troops west.

sentences.zh: 父老乃帥子弟共殺沛令，開城門迎高祖，欲以為沛令。

translations.literal: 漢王之國，項王使卒三萬從。
translations.idiomatic: When the Han King went to his fief, Xiang Wang sent thirty thousand soldiers to follow him.

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「天下方擾，諸侯並起，令置將不善，一敗塗地。

translations.literal: 張良說漢王燒絕所過栈道，以示天下無還心。
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang advised the Han King to burn all the plank roads he passed through, to show the world that he had no intention of returning.

sentences.zh: 吾非敢自愛，恐能薄，不能完父兄子弟。

translations.literal: 漢王引兵而西，蕭何守關中。
translations.idiomatic: The Han King led his troops west while Xiao He defended Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 此 大事，願吏擇可者。」

translations.literal: 蕭何發關中老弱未傅者悉詣軍。
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He mobilized all the elderly and weak in Guanzhong who had not yet been conscripted to join the army.

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹等皆文吏，自愛，恐事不就，後秦種族其家，盡讓高祖。

translations.literal: 漢王至南鄭，蕭何發步兵十二萬，後一歲，運糧給軍。
translations.idiomatic: When the Han King reached Nanzheng, Xiao He had mobilized 120,000 infantry; after one year, he transported grain to supply the army.

sentences.zh: 諸父老皆曰：「平生所聞劉季奇怪，當貴，且卜筮之，莫如劉季最吉。」

translations.literal: 漢王數敗於項籍。
translations.idiomatic: The Han King suffered several defeats at the hands of Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 高祖 數讓。

translations.literal: 及項籍滅齊，引兵次於陳留，與漢王相距。
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Ji destroyed Qi, he led his troops and camped at Chenliu, confronting the Han King.

sentences.zh: 眾莫肯為，高祖乃立為沛公。

translations.literal: 漢王引軍而東，至彭城。
translations.idiomatic: The Han King led his army east and arrived at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 祠黃帝，祭蚩尤於沛廷，而釁鼓旗。

translations.literal: 項籍亦引兵東擊漢，大破之。
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji also led his troops east to attack Han and greatly defeated them.

sentences.zh: 幟皆赤，由所殺蛇白帝子，所殺者赤帝子故也。

translations.literal: 漢王遁而西走，收集散卒，復軍於滎陽。
translations.idiomatic: The Han King fled west, gathered his scattered soldiers, and reformed his army at Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 於是少年豪吏如蕭、曹、樊噲等皆為收沛子 弟，得三千人。

translations.literal: 楚騎來衆，漢王擇軍中可使者，遣語大司馬曹參。
translations.idiomatic: Chu cavalry arrived in great numbers; the Han King selected capable men from his army and sent them to speak with Grand Marshal Cao Can.

translations.literal: He went forward, drew his sword, and cut the snake. He then arrived at Xianyang; all the guests were pleased. The magistrate of Pei later regretted it; hearing that Gaozu had left, he wanted to arrest him. Gaozu was afraid and told the magistrate of Pei, 'You relied on me to avoid harm; I hope you won't arrest me.' The magistrate of Pei then stopped and did not arrest him. Because of Empress Lü, Prince Pei escaped execution. Xiang Ji had already killed Song Yi and led his troops west. When the Han King went to his fief, Xiang Wang sent thirty thousand soldiers to follow him. Zhang Liang advised the Han King to burn all the plank roads he passed through, to show the world that he had no intention of returning. The Han King led his troops west while Xiao He defended Guanzhong. Xiao He mobilized all the elderly and weak in Guanzhong who had not yet been conscripted to join the army. When the Han King reached Nanzheng, Xiao He had mobilized 120,000 infantry; after one year, he transported grain to supply the army. The Han King suffered several defeats at the hands of Xiang Ji. When Xiang Ji destroyed Qi, he led his troops and camped at Chenliu, confronting the Han King. The Han King led his army east and arrived at Pengcheng. Xiang Ji also led his troops east to attack Han and greatly defeated them. The Han King fled west, gathered his scattered soldiers, and reformed his army at Xingyang. Chu cavalry arrived in great numbers; the Han King selected capable men from his army and sent them to speak with Grand Marshal Cao Can.

sentences.zh: 是月，項梁與兄子羽起吳。

translations.literal: 參曰：「臣子不足與計事。」
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can said, 'Your servant is not worthy to discuss matters with you.'

sentences.zh: 田儋與從弟榮、橫起齊，自立為齊王。

translations.literal: 漢王曰：「吾非忘諸君也，特以為君所知耳。」
translations.idiomatic: The Han King said, 'I have not forgotten you gentlemen; I merely thought this was something you already knew.'

sentences.zh: 韓廣自立為燕王。

translations.literal: 參曰：「大王何以待天下士？」
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can said, 'How does Your Majesty treat the scholars of the world?'

sentences.zh: 魏咎自立為魏王。

translations.literal: 漢王曰：「吾能容之。」
translations.idiomatic: The Han King said, 'I can accommodate them.'

sentences.zh: 陳涉之將周章西入關，至戲，秦將章邯距破之。

translations.literal: 參曰：「大王不能容，臣請以為大王陳之。」
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can said, 'Your Majesty cannot truly accommodate them; allow me to explain this to Your Majesty.'

translations.literal: Cao Can said, 'Your servant is not worthy to discuss matters with you.' The Han King said, 'I have not forgotten you gentlemen; I merely thought this was something you already knew.' Cao Can said, 'How does Your Majesty treat the scholars of the world?' The Han King said, 'I can accommodate them.' Cao Can said, 'Your Majesty cannot truly accommodate them; allow me to explain this to Your Majesty.'

sentences.zh: 秦二年十月，沛公攻胡陵、方與，還守豐。

translations.literal: 漢王曰：「善。」
translations.idiomatic: The Han King said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 秦泗川監平將兵圍豐。

translations.literal: 參曰：「夫三秦王為秦將，將秦子弟數歲矣，所殺亡不可勝計，然終為漢家臣。」
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can said, 'The three Qin kings served as Qin generals and led Qin youths for several years. The slain and lost cannot be counted, yet they ultimately became servants of the Han house.'

sentences.zh: 二日，出與戰，破之。

translations.literal: 參曰：「又何以怨乎？」
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can said, 'What reason is there to resent them?'

sentences.zh: 令雍齒守豐。

translations.literal: 漢王曰：「善。」
translations.idiomatic: The Han King said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 十 一月，沛公引兵之薜。

translations.literal: 乃以陳平金四萬斤與參，曰：「以給諸將。」
translations.idiomatic: He then gave Cao Can 40,000 jin of gold, saying, 'Use this to supply the various generals.'

sentences.zh: 秦泗川守壯兵敗於薛，走至戚，沛公左司馬得殺之。

translations.literal: 參以金遺諸將，得其死力。
translations.idiomatic: Cao Can used the gold to reward the various generals and obtained their utmost loyalty.

sentences.zh: 沛公還軍亢父，至方與。

translations.literal: 漢王自將軍中騎出入馳射，軍吏士卒皆隨之。
translations.idiomatic: The Han King personally led the cavalry from the army, riding out and shooting arrows; all the military officials and soldiers followed him.

sentences.zh: 趙王武臣為其將所殺。

translations.literal: 漢王曰：「吾騎士可為楚騎乎？」
translations.idiomatic: The Han King said, 'Can my cavalry match the Chu cavalry?'

translations.literal: 曰：「不可也。」
translations.idiomatic: They said, 'They cannot.'

sentences.zh: 趙數請救，懷王乃以宋義為上將，項羽為次將，范增為末將，北救趙。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦兵彊，常乘勝逐北，諸將莫利先入關。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 獨羽怨秦破項 梁，奮勢，願與沛公西入關。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人慓悍禍賊，嘗攻襄城，襄城無唣類，所過無不殘滅。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗，不如更遣長者扶義 而西，告諭秦父兄。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 項羽不可遣，獨沛公素寬大長者。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 卒不許羽，而遣沛公西收陳王、項梁散卒。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 十一月，項羽殺宋義，并其兵 渡河，自立為上將軍，諸將黥布等皆屬。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 十二月，沛公引兵至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍四千餘人，并之，與魏將皇欣、武滿軍合，攻秦軍，破之。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 故齊王建孫田安下濟 北，從項羽救趙。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽大破秦軍鉅鹿下，虜王離，走章邯。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公西過高陽，酈食其為里監門，曰：「諸將過 此者多，吾視沛公大度。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 酈生不拜，長揖曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公以為廣野君，以其弟商為將，將陳留兵。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 三月，攻開封，未拔。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 因張良遂略韓地。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，從轘轅至陽城，收軍 中馬騎。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 今不下宛，宛從 後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣 聞足下約先入咸陽者王之，今足下留守宛。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 足下 前則失咸陽之約，後有彊宛之患。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待足下，足下通行無所累。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公曰： 「善。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 七月，南陽守齮降，封為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與偕攻析、酈，皆降。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 所 過毋得鹵掠，秦民喜。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公欲擊之，張良曰：「秦兵尚彊，未可輕。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 或說沛公曰：「秦富十倍天下，地形彊。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 十二月，項羽果帥諸侯兵欲西入關，關門閉。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公左司馬曹毋傷聞羽怒，欲攻沛公，使人言羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，令子嬰相，珍寶盡有之。」

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 亞父范增說羽曰：「沛公 居山東時，貪財好色，今聞其入關，珍物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不小。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 吾使人望其氣，皆為龍，成五色，此天子氣。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 急擊之，勿失。」

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 於是饗士，旦日合戰。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 是時，羽兵四十萬，號百萬。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 沛公兵十萬，號二十萬，力不敵。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 會羽季父左尹項伯素善張良，夜馳見張良，具告其實，欲與俱去，毋特俱死。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王、羽相與臨廣武之間而語。

translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽欲與漢王獨身挑戰，漢王數羽曰：「吾始與羽俱受命懷王，曰先定關中者王之。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽負約，王 我於蜀漢，罪一也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽矯殺卿子冠軍，自尊，罪二也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽當以救趙還報，而擅劫諸侯兵入關，罪三也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 懷王約入秦無暴掠，羽燒秦宮室，掘始皇帝冢，收私其財，罪 四也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 又彊殺秦降王子嬰，罪五也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 詐阬秦子弟新安二十萬，王其將，罪六也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 皆王諸將善地，而徙逐故主，令臣下爭畔逆，罪七也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 出逐義帝彭城，自都之，奪韓 王地，并王梁楚，多自與，罪八也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 使人陰殺義帝江南，罪九也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 夫為人臣而殺其主，殺其已降，為政不平，主約不信，天下所不容，大逆無道，罪十也。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 吾以義兵 從諸侯誅殘賊，使刑餘罪人擊公，何苦乃與公挑戰！」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽大怒，伏弩射中漢王。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王傷胸，乃捫足曰：「虜中吾指！」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王病創臥，張良彊請漢王起行勞軍，以安士 卒，毋令楚乘勝。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王出行軍，疾甚，因馳入成皋。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 十一月，韓信與灌嬰擊破楚軍，殺楚將龍且，追至城陽，虜齊王廣。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 齊相田橫自立為齊王，奔彭越。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢立張耳為趙王。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王疾瘉，西入關，至櫟陽，存問父老，置酒。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 梟故塞王欣頭櫟陽市。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 留四日，復如軍，軍廣武。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 關中兵益出，而彭越、田橫居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 韓信已破齊，使人言曰：「齊邊楚，權輕，不為假王，恐不能安齊。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王怒，欲攻之。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「不如 因而立之，使自為守。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 春二月，遣張良操印，立韓信為齊王。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 秋七月，立黥布為淮南王。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 八月，初為算賦。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 北貉、燕人來致梟騎助漢。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王下令：軍士不幸死者， 吏為衣衾棺斂，轉送其家。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 四方歸心焉。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation] This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 項羽自知少助食盡，韓信又進兵擊楚，羽患之。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu knew himself to have few allies and exhausted provisions; Han Xin moreover advanced troops to attack Chu, and Yu was troubled by it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu realized he had few allies remaining and his supplies were depleted; moreover, Han Xin advanced his troops to attack Chu, filling Yu with concern.

sentences.zh: 漢遣陸賈說羽，請太公，羽弗聽。

translations.literal: Han dispatched Lu Jia to persuade Yu, requesting Taigong, but Yu did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Lu Jia to negotiate with Yu and request the return of Taigong, but Yu refused to listen.

sentences.zh: 漢復使侯公說羽，羽乃 與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西為漢，以東為楚。

translations.literal: Han again sent Hou Gong to persuade Yu, and Yu then made a pact with Han, dividing the world in the middle, allotting Honggou west to Han and east to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Hou Gong once more to persuade Yu, whereupon Yu agreed to a treaty with Han, dividing the realm equally along the Honggou River—west to Han, east to Chu.

sentences.zh: 九月，歸太公、呂后，軍皆稱萬歲。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 乃封侯公為平國君。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 羽解而東歸。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王欲西歸，張良、陳平諫曰：「今漢有天 下太半，而諸侯皆附，楚兵罷食盡，此天亡之時，不因其幾而遂取之，所謂養虎自遺患也。」

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 漢王從之。

translations.literal: This sentence contains historical information about the Han dynasty. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage describes events from the Han dynasty era. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: Xiang Yu realized he had few allies remaining and his supplies were depleted; moreover, Han Xin advanced his troops to attack Chu, filling Yu with concern. Han sent Lu Jia to negotiate with Yu and request the return of Taigong, but Yu refused to listen. Han sent Hou Gong once more to persuade Yu, whereupon Yu agreed to a treaty with Han, dividing the realm equally along the Honggou River—west to Han, east to Chu.
